Austin, March 06, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Precision Farming Market Size & Growth Insights:
According to the SNS Insider,“The Precision Farming Market was valued at USD 10.35 billion in 2023 and is estimated to reach USD 29.25 billion by 2032, growing at a CAGR of 12.24% from 2024 to 2032.”
Precision farming is a fast-growing technology-driven sector that utilizes technologies like GPS, drone, sensors and automated machinery for economically boosted agricultural practice. It lets farmers achieve high efficiency, reduce wastage, and increase yield by closely monitoring and managing their fields at real-time. As the global population continues to grow resulting in a rising demand for food, precision agriculture provides a sustainable means to meet these increasing demands. The precision farming market is broad with applications including yield monitoring, variable rate technology, soil mapping, and crop scouting.

Key Industry Segmentation
By Offering: Hardware Dominates, Software Registers Fastest CAGR
The hardware segment dominated the market and accounted for 55% in 2023, as its adoption is increasing with the GPS devices, sensors, and automatic machines. The growth of smart tractors, drones, and IoT-enabled farming equipment is helping farmers to make more investments in them to improve productivity. growth to be accelerated by hardware innovations such as robotic harvesters and precision planters.
The Software segment held the fastest CAGR during 2024–2032 owing to increasing adoption of cloud-based and AI-powered farm management solutions. With data-driven decision-making, predictive analytics, and remote monitoring behind the functionality of these software solutions, farming operations can reach a level of efficiency and sustainability never seen before.
By Application: Yield Monitoring Dominates, Irrigation Management Registers Fastest CAGR
The Yield Monitoring segment dominated the market and accounted for significant revenue share in 2023, as it guides farmers with crop productivity tracking, field variability, and resource allocation. Satellite imagery, drones and AI-based analytics aid in the estimation of yield to help plan agriculture with precision.
The Irrigation Management segment is anticipated to have the highest CAGR value, as it addresses the rising demand for advanced irrigation technology and more efficient use of water resources. Smart irrigation systems that use IoT sensors and AI-based forecasting tools are minimizing the water usage in insecure areas and increasing productivity, enabling its adoption.
Key Regional Developments: North America Dominates the Precision Farming Market, Asia-Pacific Registers the Fastest CAGR
North America dominated the market and accounted for 45% revenue share in 2023, driven by the high rate of penetration of precision agriculture technologies, governmental support, and by the presence of a large number of agritech startups. While the U.S. and Canada are at the Forefront of AI-driven smart and Drone-Based Monitoring and Autonomous Farm Machinery, return to the market growth. Furthermore, the rising requirements of data-driven farm management solutions are expected to help the region in retaining the lead of the market.
The Asia-Pacific region is expected to register the fastest CAGR during the forecast period, driven by expanding government initiatives supporting smart agriculture, high demand for food driven by a burgeoning population, and rapidly evolving digitization in agriculture. Rapid investment in AI-driven precision agriculture systems, smart irrigation systems, and automated agricultural machinery along with increased investment in surveillance is enabling countries including India, China, and Japan. Rising presence of government subsidies towards modern farming techniques and low-cost IoT solution adoption is expected to boost market growth in the region.

text:
A man was arrested on Wednesday for a deadly vehicle accident that happened in East Huntingdon Township back in 2021.
The man was identified as 38-year-old Earl Gilbert of Scottdale.
According to Westmoreland County DA's Office, Gilbert was charged by Pennsylvania State Police with homicide by vehicle, recklessly endangering another person, reckless driving and multiple traffic citations.
In September 2021, troopers responded to a two-vehicle accident in East Huntingdon Township.
According to the DA the road conditions were slick with rain, and police said GIlbert lost control on a roadway when attempting to gain control of his vehicle as it then spun out of control into the path of an oncoming vehicle.
The vehicles collided and Gilbert was flown to the hospital, the passenger of the vehicle was deceased on the scene.
Investigators said Gilbert was in possession of five grams of cocaine and approximately one gram of marijuana when he was being treated at a hospital following the accident.
title: Man charged for fatal vehicle accident in East Huntingdon Township
description: A man has been charged and arrested for a vehicle accident that happened in 2021 in East Huntingdon Township.
